messages.content: ComfyUI-Catcat is an extension that enhances user experience by providing a visual indicator of execution processes during queueing prompts in a fun and engaging way, displaying random cat GIFs at the bottom left of the screen.
Who is the idea credited to and who built ComfyUI-Catcat?
The idea for ComfyUI-Catcat is credited to Hyacinth and it was built by Chenran.
To install ComfyUI-Catcat, go to the ComfyUI/custom_nodes directory in the terminal, run 'git clone https://github.com/jw782cn/ComfyUI-Catcat.git', and then restart ComfyUI.
How can I use ComfyUI-Catcat in my workflow?
To use ComfyUI-Catcat, simply run your workflow and random cats will appear during renderings.
How can I add more cat GIFs to ComfyUI-Catcat?

To add more cat GIFs, place your GIFs into the 'web/images' directory of your project, update the 'gifFilenames' array in the 'cat.js' file with the relative path to your new GIFs, and save the changes.
What updates were made to ComfyUI-Catcat on 03/08?
The extension added drag-and-drop and resize features.
What does the disclaimer of ComfyUI-Catcat state?
The disclaimer states that ComfyUI-Catcat is designed for fun and does not guarantee proper functioning.
Who provides the base for ComfyUI-Catcat?
ComfyUI-Catcat is based on the ComfyUI framework, so credit is given to ComfyUI.
